turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to file an insurance claim. I had a car accident last week.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello. I'm sorry to hear about your accident. I can help you with that. To start, could you please provide your policy number and the date of the accident?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, my policy number is XYZ12345, and the accident happened on October 26th. This is already frustrating; I've been dealing with this all week!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. Thank you for providing that information. I've accessed your policy. Could you please briefly describe the accident, including the other vehicle involved and any injuries sustained?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Well, I was rear-ended at a stoplight. The other driver's insurance info is ABC98765. I have some whiplash, and my car's pretty damaged. The other driver admitted fault at the scene. However, why does my premium go up if it wasn't my fault?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a valid concern. While your premium *may* increase in some scenarios, it depends on several factors, like state laws, the specifics of the accident, and your driving history. We will investigate the accident details and determine fault. Your premium is usually not affected if the other driver is found 100% at fault, but it's not always a guaranteed outcome. I can provide you with more specific information related to your policy as we investigate the claim. Currently, the claim is being assessed, and you should hear back from us within 7-10 business days regarding liability.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, that makes sense, I suppose. As long as it is resolved quickly and I'm not stuck paying for the damages. Thanks for your help so far.
